message.content:
Chain-mail is a type of armor made up of small metal rings linked together in a pattern resembling a net.
It is typically made of steel or sometimes aluminum.
The rings are interlocked to create a flexible and protective mesh or fabric-like material.
The surface of chain-mail often appears shiny and metallic in color.
It has a distinctive texture, with a series of interwoven rings that form a repeating pattern.
Chain-mail was historically used as a form of protection by medieval knights and warriors, but is now mainly used for decorative and cosplay purposes.
It can be found in historical reenactments, museums, and collections of antique weaponry.
